description: NBC News' Marissa Parra reports on a newly discovered Mayan city in Mexico, which researchers found by accident and estimate once housed tens of thousands of people. Over time, the city was overtaken by wilderness, but new laser technology is now revealing insights into how its inhabitants once lived.
title: Researchers discover ancient Maya city in Mexico using laser technology

description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday rejected a long-shot bid by Robert F. Kennedy Jr., who ended his independent presidential campaign, seeking his removal from the ballot in the key swing states of Wisconsin and Michigan.
title: Supreme Court rejects RFK Jr. plea to be removed from ballot in two swing states

description: Kamala Harris' final events have been far more disciplined, while Donald Trump's have often been eclipsed by his off-the-cuff comments and his allies' crude remarks.
title: Trump threatens to drown out his closing message in the final days of the election

description: Former President Donald Trump defends his Madison Square Garden rally, where an opening speaker referred to Puerto Rico as an "island of garbage" and criticizes comparisons to a 1939 Nazi rally held at the venue.
title: Trump calls his Madison Square Garden rally 'a lovefest'

description: Steve Bannon, the former advisor to former President Donald Trump, completed his nearly four-month prison sentence for a contempt of Congress charge. NBC News’ Ken Dilanian reports on Bannon’s refusal to comply with a subpoena from the Jan. 6 House committee and what his release means for the MAGA movement.
title: Steve Bannon released from prison after 4-month contempt of Congress sentence

description: Exit polls, large-scale studies of voters, now include phone calls to early and mail voters as well as interviews outside polling places on Election Day.
title: How exit polls work and how NBC News uses them on election night

description: If Donald Trump or his allies tried to derail the electoral process, they would run up against an array of new guardrails this time around, legal experts say.
title: Why it would be difficult for Trump to reverse the 2024 election results

description: One video shared by Musk and America PAC was created by a user who had previously shared what appeared to be neo-Nazi imagery.
title: Musk and his super PAC share violent and vulgar videos about Kamala Harris

description: CNN has banned Ryan Girdusky from appearing on the network again after he told Mehdi Hasan "I hope your beeper doesn't go off," an apparent reference to the spate of exploding pagers in Lebanon that killed members of the Hezbollah militant group last month.
title: CNN bans conservative guest for telling Muslim journalist 'I hope your beeper doesn't go off'

description: Ramses Alcaide, CEO & Co-founder of Neurable, talks with NBC News' Gadi Schwartz about their new technology headphones that tracks user's brain signals.
title: 'Mind-reading' headphones track user's brain signals

description: A Virginia state park has new technology in special viewfinders that allow people who are color blind to see the full color spectrum of the fall foliage. NBC News' Valerie Castro visits the park ranger who sparked the idea.
title: Special viewfinders in Virginia enable colorblind people to see fall foliage

description: Jeff Bezos, the billionaire Amazon founder who owns The Washington Post, defended the newspaper's decision to stop endorsing presidential candidates, arguing in part that the move is a way to shore up credibility and combat perceptions of political bias.
title: Jeff Bezos defends Washington Post’s decision to stop presidential endorsements days before election
